alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coweta; Douglas; Heard; South Fulton; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 4:44PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Carroll, southwestern Douglas, Heard, northwestern Troup, northwestern Coweta and southwestern Fulton Counties through 530 PM EST... At 443 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Treasure Lake to Crystal Lake, and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Newnan, Carrollton, Franklin, City of South Fulton, Union City, Fairburn, Palmetto, Whitesburg, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Roopville, Chattahoochee Hills, Plant Yates, Seaton Lake, Fairplay, Dunaway Gardens, Clem, Glenn, Byers Crossroads and Hannah. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EST for northwestern and west central Georgia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM EST for north central Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Coweta; Douglas; Heard; South Fulton; Troup
